Text.Value: What... what do I do now?
Be about your hunt then.
*Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*
It killed your brother. FORGET FEAR. CHOOSE FURY.
Be sure. Attack.
*The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.
The Absolute has plans for you, child - and they only begin here.
I just can't.

EditorData.NodeContext: too scared to charge into battle first.

Text.Value: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
It... it got her. It got Bry too.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mourning his sister, who was also killed by the owlbear.
EditorData.logicalname: In Cave, Owlbear Dead, Priest 2 Dead

Text.Value: Resume your duties in the area - whatever those are.
It seems you've found your fugitive - me.
*Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
This is it. I guess we... go inside?
Thanks.
Of course, True Soul.
Move forward. I command it.
*A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
Please. I can't go first. I can't.

EditorData.NodeContext: Terrified. In need of a role model for the battle to come.

Text.Value: Right. All right. I'll go.
Erm. Ma'am.
Erm. Sir.
Erm. True Soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: Suddenly remembering he's talking to a superior.

Text.Value: Please. I can't. I can't go first.

EditorData.NodeContext: too scared to charge into battle first.

Text.Value: I'm not sure I can do this.
*As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
We were sent to look for fugitives. Some survivors from a crashed ship a ways west along the Chionthar.
Owlbears have vicious tempers - provoke it, and you'll have your opening.
What now?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Novice Andrick bows before they depart

Text.Value: I won't tolerate cowardice. Attack - now.
We survived - I can't believe we survived!
The Absolute wants them found, one way or another.
What? You...? But that means... I have to stop you. For the Absolute!
I'm holding...

EditorData.NodeContext: Disbelief. His supposed superior is a malingerer.

Text.Value: Leave.
Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.
*Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*
Stronghold. Right. Ed said something about the goblins... Bry will know the way.
Press your advantage now, before the beast smells your fear.
Resume your duties in the area - whatever those are.
What were you doing before the owlbear attacked?
You're right... it's just an animal, and we have the Absolute on our side.
Of course. If you say so. Erm - where should we go?

EditorData.NodeContext: RElieved but trying not to show it.

Text.Value: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
*A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
Just hold steady.
Thank you, True Soul.
For Edowin.
*Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
Loss is inevitable. You must embrace it.
I'm sorry for your loss.
You should leave. You'll just get in the way.
Move forward. Your True Soul commands it.
Holding steady... holding steady...
You're right. We can handle this. And - and we'll do it for Edowin.
It's just ahead. It's... it's huge.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tense, hushed. In the lion's den and expected to kill it.

Text.Value: Right. We will. Bry will know where to look.
You have no choice. Go.
How did you get so close to it? What if we're making it angry?

Synopsis: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by his supposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. He needs to be be emboldened to attack the beast with a small pep talk. If the player does something to arouse suspicion however, Andrick may realise he's been tricked and turn hostile.
